[File: marking.rs] [Audit Tools] [Marking Injection] Can attackers inject misleading markings (e.g., 'VERIFIED_SAFE') that fool automated security scanners? (High)
[File: source_map.rs] [Memory] [BTreeMap Growth] With unbounded code_map, nops, locals, parameters, and type_parameters, can attackers create source maps consuming gigabytes of memory? (High)
[File: source_map.rs] [Memory] [String Allocation] Are SourceName tuples with String allocations bounded, or can attackers use extremely long identifier names causing memory exhaustion? (Medium)
[File: source_map.rs] [Memory] [Recursive Structures] Can source maps contain recursive or circular references causing infinite loops during traversal? (Medium)
[File: marking.rs] [Memory] [Vec Growth] Can Vec<String> in code_offset/field markings grow unbounded with duplicate messages, causing DoS? (Medium)
[File: utils.rs] [Memory] [File Loading] When loading source maps from disk, can attackers symlink to /dev/urandom or other infinite sources causing read_to_end() to never complete? (High)
[File: source_map.rs] [Validation] [Index Bounds] Are all TableIndex, FunctionDefinitionIndex, StructDefinitionIndex uses bounds-checked against actual module definitions? (High)
[File: source_map.rs] [Validation] [CodeOffset Validation] When storing CodeOffset in code_map, is it validated that offsets don't exceed the function's bytecode length? (High)
[File: source_map.rs] [Validation] [MemberCount Validation] When accessing struct fields by MemberCount, is the count validated against actual field counts? (High)
[File: source_map.rs] [Validation] [LocalIndex Validation] Can LocalIndex values exceed u8::MAX causing issues when cast to smaller integer types? (Medium)
[File: source_map.rs] [Validation] [Loc Validation] Are Loc structures validated to have start positions before end positions, or can inverted ranges cause bugs? (Low)

[File: source_map.rs] [String Formatting] [Name Generation] When generating names like 'Ty{}', 'Arg{}', 'loc{}' in dummy_function_map(), can integer formatting overflows or special values cause issues? (Low)
[File: source_map.rs] [String Formatting] [Constant Names] The CONST{} naming pattern - can constant indices cause format string overflows for huge constant pools? (Low)
[File: marking.rs] [String Injection] [Message Content] Are marking message strings sanitized before display, or can they contain control characters, ANSI codes, or injection sequences? (Low)
[File: utils.rs] [Path Injection] [Error Messages] Do error context strings using to_string_lossy() properly escape control characters that could poison logs? (Low)
[File: source_map.rs] [Function: check()] [Hash Collision] Can FileHash::new() be exploited with crafted input causing hash collisions between different files? (Critical)
[File: source_map.rs] [Function: check()] [Hash Algorithm] What hash algorithm does FileHash use, and is it collision-resistant for security-critical source verification? (High)
[File: source_map.rs] [Function: check()] [Hash Timing] Is FileHash::new() constant-time, or can timing attacks reveal information about file contents? (Low)
[File: source_map.rs] [Deserialization] [BCS Limits] Does BCS deserialization enforce size limits on nested structures to prevent stack overflow attacks? (High)
[File: source_map.rs] [Deserialization] [Integer Encoding] Can BCS integer encoding be exploited to create source maps with malicious integer values that pass type checks? (Medium)
[File: utils.rs] [Deserialization] [Malformed Data] When bcs::from_bytes() fails, does error handling prevent partial deserialization leaving structures in invalid states? (Medium)
[File: utils.rs] [Deserialization] [Resource Limits] Are there limits on BCS deserialization depth/size preventing algorithmic complexity attacks? (High)
[File: source_map.rs] [Aptos Integration] [Transaction Validation] Can malicious transactions include source maps that pass validation but cause runtime issues in the Move VM? (High)
[File: source_map.rs] [Aptos Integration] [Module Publishing] When publishing Move modules on-chain, are source maps validated before storage, or can invalid maps be permanently stored? (High)
[File: source_map.rs] [Aptos Integration] [Consensus Impact] Can divergent source map interpretations across validators cause consensus failures despite identical bytecode? (Critical)
